primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a world of injustice and sin to justify/rectify humanity and the cosmos through the sacrifice of His Son, ensuring that no condemnation remains for those in Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God did not spare his own Son but gave him up for us all
God is going to take care of injustice

object.identificatie: Justification/Rectification (The making right of all things)
tekstueel_bewijs: God is going to make the figures come out right

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of the 'orders' and the cost)
tekstueel_bewijs: cost the Lord a price so great
gave him up for us all
nothing can separate us from the love of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a gift they cannot produce.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Intercessor) and the Holy Spirit (implied in 'power beyond human imagining')
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus... indeed intercedes for us
by a power beyond human imagining
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Mediator).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that enables the 'readiness' to receive.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Injustice, Condemnation, and the 'Accuser'
tekstueel_bewijs: treachery and terrorism and every kind of evildoing
the ways of sin that separate us
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'everlasting condemnation' and 'cosmic powers' that only God can defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response to God's grace through the practice of costly forgiveness and reconciliation toward others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human forgiveness is explicitly described as 'derivative' from God's primary act of justification.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God did not spare his own Son
God is going to take care of wickedness
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We receive it as a gift
I do not need to set myself up
we cannot have confidence in [our renunciation]

voorbeelden: wish for that man to be restored
The knowledge that each one of us is a sinner
we know we cannot accurately evaluate
by a power beyond human imagining
not something we produce in ourselves by force of human will
nothing will be able to separate us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God over the 'Devoir' (Duty) of man. Human inability is the backdrop for Divine capability.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the fear of S2 (Condemnation) through the rejection of ~S1 (Cheap Grace) to the realization of S1 (Justification) via the 'cost' paid by Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the weight of S2, allowing S1 to be a 'costly' reality rather than a 'cheap' fiction.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon explicitly mentions the Last Judgment and the reality of 'great wrong' and 'atrocities'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and rectification, while framing human action as a derivative response.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Mandela has set a personal example by reaching out

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of Verbs

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: treachery and terrorism and every kind of evildoing

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mandela and Tutu are used as examples, but they are framed as people 'teaching' the nation to 'receive the gift' rather than achieving it by sheer will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by noting that Mandela's example is a sign of 'trusting God to make that evaluation'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the burden of self-justification and vindictiveness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic justification; the believer is the beneficiary of God's cosmic 'making right'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly ordered: God's primary act of justification enables and necessitates the secondary act of human forgiveness.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of no condemnation and the 'not yet' of the Last Judgment.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: death on the Cross... in place of us sinners

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (God's will) works in the believer to enable the 'readiness' to forgive.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is described as something that would 'doom' us if it could separate us from Christ.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The 'engine' is grace-driven.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to emphasize that 'willing' (Vouloir) follows 'being able' (Pouvoir) via the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Injustice) is already presented as insurmountable by human effort.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism while still addressing ethical imperatives. It anchors human action entirely in the prior and superior action of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of the Susan Cohen or South Africa anecdotes for emotional impact; Greimas shows these are actantial illustrations of the 'Opponent' and the 'Secondary Program'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what 'dikaios' means; Greimas shows how 'Justification' functions as the 'Object' that God (Subject) achieves for us (Receiver).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that even when the preacher says 'we must forgive,' the underlying structure ensures 'we' are not the heroes, but the 'Receivers' of the capacity to do so.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively, ensuring the active verbs of the primary soteriological movement belong to God.
